Class Shield

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.component.Component
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.component.Shield
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activable, Rotatable, Serializable
public class Shield extends Component implements Activable, Rotatable
Represents a shield component, extending the Component class. Implements the Activable and Rotatable interfaces.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getComponentName

      public String getComponentName()
      Retrieves the name of the component.
      Specified by:
      getComponentName in class Component
      Returns:
      the name of the component as a string

    • getDirections

      public List<Direction> getDirections()
      Gets the active shield directions.
      Returns:
      a list of Direction where the shield is active

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Rotates the shield component by 90 degrees clockwise. This method updates the shield's active directions by using Rotatable.shiftDirection(Direction) to compute the new directions after rotation. It also invokes the base implementation of rotate in the Component class to adjust the orientation of connectors.
      Overrides:
      rotate in class Component

    • getLabel

      public String getLabel()
      Retrieves the label associated with the shield component. The label is a short string identifier used to represent the component type.
      Specified by:
      getLabel in class Component
      Returns:
      the label of the shield component as a string ("SLD")

    • getMainAttribute

      public String getMainAttribute()
      Retrieves a string representation of the main attribute for the shield component. The main attribute corresponds to a shorthand notation of the active directions, concatenated together. Each direction is represented as: - "N" for NORTH - "S" for SOUTH - "W" for WEST - "E" for EAST
      Specified by:
      getMainAttribute in class Component
      Returns:
      a string representing the main attribute of the shield, concatenating all active directions' shorthand notations.
